meanings.definition: Establishing or organizing something as a formal institution.
meanings.sent1: The community is institutionalizing the new library by making it an official part of the town.
meanings.sent2: The government is institutionalizing the new policy to ensure it becomes a permanent rule.
meanings.sent3: The school is institutionalizing the annual talent show to showcase the students' abilities.
meanings.sent4: By institutionalizing the tradition of family dinners, we are strengthening our bond.
meanings.sent5: Institutionalizing the recycling program will help protect the environment for future generations.

meanings.definition: Making something a standard or accepted practice.
meanings.sent1: The company is institutionalizing remote work to adapt to modern trends.
meanings.sent2: Institutionalizing handwashing before meals has become a common health practice.
meanings.sent3: The family is institutionalizing Sunday hikes to promote a healthy lifestyle.
meanings.sent4: By institutionalizing honesty, we create a culture of trust and integrity.
meanings.sent5: Institutionalizing kindness in our daily interactions can make the world a better place.

meanings.definition: Placing someone in a mental institution.
meanings.sent1: The doctor is institutionalizing the patient for further evaluation.
meanings.sent2: In extreme cases, institutionalizing individuals may be necessary for their safety.
meanings.sent3: The movie character joked about institutionalizing their annoying neighbor.
meanings.sent4: She felt guilty about institutionalizing her pet parrot in a bird sanctuary.
meanings.sent5: Institutionalizing individuals with mental health issues should be done with compassion and care.
